news.title: Infra.Market gets Sebi nod to float IPO
news.para: Tiger Global-backed construction material supply firm Infra.Market proposed an IPO worth between Rs 4,500 crore and Rs 5,500 crore with market regulator Sebi using the confidential pre-filing route in October last year, market sources said.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government invites bids for phase II of Amaravati master plan
news.para: The state government is accelerating capital city development with phase II, launching a land pooling scheme for 16,000 acres. A master plan, including economic strategies, is being prepared by global consultants to guide land use, infrastructure, and zoning. This phase prioritizes a global sports arena and international airport, ensuring structured expansion and landowner benefits.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government extends LRS application deadline to April 23, 2026
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government has extended the deadline for its Layout Regularisation Scheme. Applications can now be submitted until April 23, 2026. This extension follows numerous requests from the public. The scheme aims to regularise plots across municipal areas. Funds collected will improve civic infrastructure. Unregularised plots will face restrictions.

news.title: Lucknow development body to develop luxury flats in Gomtinagar Extension
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority is launching Narmada Apartment in Gomtinagar Extension, offering 300 luxury 3BHK+study flats and 12 penthouses. Registrations open January 24th, with applications exclusively online. The project, priced from Rs 1.4 crore, will feature modern amenities and is expected to be completed in three years.

news.title: Nashik: Over 75,000 beneficiaries to get new homes on Republic Day
news.para: Nashik Zilla Parishad has facilitated the construction of over 75,000 homes, with 51,000 under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Rural) and 24,000 through state schemes. Beneficiaries, including vulnerable sections, will receive keys to their new homes on Republic Day, fulfilling the 'housing for all' dream in rural areas.

news.title: Builders flag e-khata delays, seek Greater Bengaluru authority’s intervention to reduce bottlenecks
news.para: Karnataka builders are facing significant delays in property registrations and project handovers due to e-khata and approval bottlenecks, even for projects with occupancy certificates. Credai Karnataka has urged for urgent intervention to streamline these administrative procedures. The sector also seeks revisions to affordable housing definitions and tax reductions to ease cost pressures.

news.title: Builders to pay ₹25,000 penalty for delayed quarterly reports: Karnataka RERA
news.para: Karnataka Rera will penalize real estate promoters Rs 25,000 per quarter for failing to submit project progress reports starting financial year 2025-26. Promoters have a final chance to submit overdue reports by February 20, 2026, without penalty. This move aims to protect homebuyer rights and ensure project transparency. Builders suggest penalties should be nominal, while homebuyers welcome the initiative.

news.title: Mumbai: Mhada to pay ₹200 crore to take back three of four vacant plots
news.para: Mhada will pay Rs 200 crore to re-acquire three plots linked to the Rs 1,039-crore Patra Chawl redevelopment scam, with the state cabinet approving the payment. This move is part of Mhada's consent terms filed before the High Court, aiming to resolve a contempt petition by builder Guruashish Constructions.

news.title: Noida techie death: NBW against Lotus founder Nirmal Singh, cops say raids on to arrest him
news.para: A non-bailable warrant has been issued for Lotus Greens founder Nirmal Singh in connection with the drowning death of engineer Yuvraj Mehta. Singh is absconding, with police warning of property attachment if he doesn't surrender. He faces charges under environmental acts and BNS sections for negligence and public nuisance.

news.title: Lucknow: Rohtas Project's properties worth ₹158 crore attached under PMLA case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate in Lucknow has provisionally attached 75 immovable and two movable properties valued at Rs 158.85 crore in a money laundering case involving Rohtas Project Limited. These assets, with a market value exceeding Rs 350 crore, were seized under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

news.title: Chronos Properties renews ₹148 crore bank guarantee to stay in race for IL&FS office premise
news.para: Chronos Properties has renewed Rs 148 crore bank guarantee, ensuring they remain a contender for the IL&FS headquarters located in the Bandra Kurla Complex. Adhering to the guidelines set by the insolvency appellate tribunal, the company has submitted demand drafts to the tribunal registrar, with the renewal being crucial to avoid disqualification.

news.title: Pride Hotels gets Sebi nod to raise ₹1,000 crore via IPO
news.para: Pride Hotels has received the green light from Sebi for its upcoming Initial Public Offering, aiming to raise Rs 1,000 crore. This influx of funds will be used to revamp existing hotels, settling debts, and catering to corporate endeavors.

news.title: India Cements posts loss of ₹2.67 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: India Cements, now part of the Aditya Birla Group, posted a net loss of Rs 2.67 crore for the December quarter of FY26. This contrasts with a profit in the previous year, mainly due to exceptional items. Revenue from operations saw a significant jump of 18.55 percent.

news.title: DLF to enter senior living homes segment
news.para: DLF is set to launch a senior living housing project in Gurugram this quarter. The project has an estimated revenue potential of Rs 2,000 crore. This marks DLF's entry into the senior living segment. The company remains confident in meeting its annual sales target despite a recent dip in bookings.

news.title: CBI lens on Wiztown Planners; how it entered Noida Sports City framework
news.para: The tragic death of a techie has intensified the CBI's probe into Noida's Sports City project, focusing on Wiztown Planners Pvt Ltd. The investigation into alleged irregularities, including financial losses and regulatory lapses, has widened following the incident and a CAG report highlighting systemic failures.

news.title: Aarvee Engineering Consultants to draft master plan for Hathras Urban City
news.para: Yamuna Authority has appointed Aarvee Engineering Consultants to prepare a master plan for Hathras Urban City, a new 4,000-hectare urban center. The plan, to be completed in nine months, will guide the city's growth until 2041, focusing on industrial and residential development, MSME promotion, and infrastructure enhancement.

news.title: SAA expands its Pune footprint with over ₹2,700 crore residential mandates
news.para: SAA, an innovative force in real estate strategy and marketing, is gearing up for remarkable growth in Pune. With a portfolio of residential projects totaling around INR 2700 crore set for the upcoming financial year, this comes on the heels of a robust two-year journey in the city.

news.title: HC pushes Nagpur civic body to act on illegal buildings near Vidhan Bhavan
news.para: Nagpur Municipal Corporation is finally demolishing illegal constructions in two prominent buildings after years of judicial prodding. Notices have been issued, with demolition set to occur if owners fail to comply. This action follows sharp High Court observations regarding extensive unauthorized building work and administrative delays.

news.title: Nashik civic body intensifies property tax recovery drive for 2025-26 target
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation is intensifying property tax recovery to meet its Rs 275 crore target for 2025-26, with Rs 63 crore still outstanding. Following a successful amnesty scheme that collected Rs 66 crore, the civic body will issue fresh notices to defaulters. This push aims to recover current dues and a significant backlog of Rs 500 crore.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government proposes to revise land market values in urban areas from Feb 1
news.para: Andhra Pradesh government plans to revise urban land market values from February 1st to align with actual transaction prices and boost state revenue. This move, aimed at preventing revenue leakage, has raised concerns among real estate stakeholders about increased costs and potential dampening of buyer sentiment.
